etymology.description: Depicts an eye, now rotated 90 degrees
etymology.interpretation: The character represents a human eye turned sideways from its original vertical representation. This rotation allows it to fit within the square shape of Chinese characters. The form clearly resembles the horizontal structure of an eye, emphasizing its role in vision.

examples.chinese: 她有美丽的眼睛(她有美麗的眼睛)。
目不转睛(目不轉睛)地看。
examples.pinyin: mù bù zhuǎn jīng de kàn.

examples.chinese: 他的目光很锐利(他的目光很銳利)。
